page.title: 15FIRST SCHOOLS
page.content: There are 2 schools for children aged 4-12 years-{Westcott Primary {School}and{Powell Corderoy Primary and {Middle School. { }An interview with{Miss Ilsley,}the head of Westcott Primary, revealed that there are{50 children}aged between 4 and 8 at the school, even though there are places for 110. Most of the children live in Westcott - 3 or 4 live in Dorking. Miss Ilsley enjoys working at the school because of, {"The family-like atmosphere". There has been a general decline in the number of children in Dorking schools and this has affected Powell Corderoy Middle School. The school is to close in the near future and the pupils transferred to other middle schools in Dorking. Parents and staff are naturally upset and have mounted a {campaign}of opposition to the proposal
